subject: Investing
title: Defensive vs. Cyclical Stocks
description: A quick, practical guide to Defensive vs. Cyclical Stocks.

hook.text: People buy toothpaste in a recession. They skip new cars. That difference defines defensive vs. cyclical stocks.

buildup.text: Defensive stocks sell necessities: food, utilities, healthcare. Demand barely changes regardless of the economy.

discovery.text: Cyclical stocks sell luxuries and discretionary goods. Autos, airlines, and hotels boom and bust with the economy.

twist.text: Cyclicals soar during recoveries. Defensives lag badly in bull markets. Neither is always better.

climax.text: Smart allocation rotates: defensives when storm clouds gather, cyclicals when the sun comes out.

punchline.text: Defensives protect your sleep. Cyclicals fund your dreams.

quiz.question: What makes a stock 'defensive'?
options: It sells necessities with stable demand
It has the highest growth rate
It only trades during bear markets
